description:
Exports: Value (in US dollars)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
51000 Foreign trade

Definition:
As a rule the value, which is expressed in 1,000 US dollars,
refers to the statistical value (border value). Generally,
the statistical value is the value billed for a commodity.
It is defined as the value of goods free German border.
Customs duties, taxes or other charges are not included in
the statistical value. Regarding imports or exports
following processing, the value of a commodity is its value
before processing plus the cost of processing and other
costs free border. If goods are traded free of charge or in
the context of hire or leasing transactions to be declared,
the value of the goods is the market price that would
probably have been realised in a purchase/sales transaction.
The same applies to goods delivered between linked
enterprises where internal prices were used.
